title: Microsoft: in the green with brokerage comments
full_text: Microsoft gained nearly 1% in early trading on Wall Street, on the back of favorable comments from Wedbush, which reaffirmed its 'outperform' opinion on the stock on its list of best ideas for 2024, with a price target raised from $425 to $450.The stock still needs to price in what we see as the next wave of cloud and AI growth for Microsoft, with a strong competitive advantage in the cloud over Amazon and Google", the broker believes.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: MICROSOFT :  Wedbush raises its price target
full_text: Wedbush reaffirms its 'outperform' rating on Microsoft, a stock on its 2024 Best Ideas list, with a price target raised from $425 to $450, highlighting the AI-related prospects for the IT giant.According to the broker, the very near prospect of a 'game-changing' monetization of Co-Pilot is Microsoft's 'iPhone moment', and AI may thus change its growth trajectory in the cloud in the very next few years.'The stock still needs to price in what we see as the next wave of cloud and AI growth for the Microsoft case, with a strong competitive advantage in the cloud over Amazon and Google', believes Wedbush.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Meta: share price rises as Wedbush raises target
full_text: Meta's share price rose on Wednesday, as Wedbush raised its target price on the stock, which it considers to be one of its best Internet investment ideas for 2024.Shortly before 10:00 a.m. (New York time), the stock gained 0.8%, while the S&P 500 index advanced 0.1% at the same time.In a wide-ranging study devoted to Internet stocks, Wedbush Securities explains that platforms exposed to consumer consumption should remain well positioned next year.Its best ideas in this field are Amazon (e-commerce), Meta (digital advertising), Booking (online travel reservations) and Uber (mobility services).For Wedbush, Meta should benefit - like Amazon and Google - from the emergence of new services in generative artificial intelligence likely to be monetized and extended.Against this backdrop, the broker has raised its price target on the stock from $350 to $420, while renewing its 'outperform' rating on the social media giant.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: TESLA :  Wedbush confident about Q4 deliveries
full_text: Wedbush reaffirms its 'outperform' rating and $350 price target on Tesla, judging the automaker to be slightly ahead of schedule on its path to break through the 480,000 vehicle delivery milestone in the fourth quarter.According to Wedbush, volumes in China for the period 'should reach a new record high, as the Category 5 storm that hit Tesla in 2023 appears to have passed, with the company now raising prices and seeing firm demand in this key region'.We see Tesla where Apple was in 2008-09, when the latter was just beginning to monetize its services and ecosystem in gold, and the market did not perceive the broader golden vision', adds the broker, who points to Tesla's Supercharger network.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: NIKE :  Wedbush lowers EPS forecast
full_text: Nike has announced mixed results for its second accounting quarter, accompanied by a disappointing outlook and the announcement of restructuring measures.Wedbush notes that while EPS for the quarter rose by 21% to $1.03, beating consensus by a wide margin, revenues of $13.4 billion were down 1% in local currencies, whereas the group had expected them to rise slightly.They now anticipate more difficult second-half results, leading them to reduce their full-year revenue growth forecast to +1%, rather than a mid-single-digit percentage," the broker also points out.Wedbush is therefore lowering its EPS forecast for the current year from $3.70 to $3.48 ('although it would remain unchanged without a 20-25 cent restructuring charge expected in the second half'), and that for the following year from $4.30 to $4.21.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ADOBE :  Jefferies confirms its Buy rating on the stock
full_text: Jefferies maintains its Buy rating on Adobe shares, with a price target of $700. The broker reports that Adobe and Figma have agreed to terminate the agreement under which Adobe was to purchase Figma. As a result, Adobe will have to pay a billion dollars in termination fees. "We expected the deal to go through given the success of the VMW and ATVI agreements, but we were wrong," admits the analyst. We still believe that competition concerns are exaggerated and that the products are complementary. Jefferies nevertheless believes that Adobe's creative business 'remainsstrong' and points to an improved outlook thanks to AI. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: Jefferies reaffirms its 'hold' recommendation and $120 price target on Nike, arguing that according to its digital data panel, interest in sneakers accelerated during the holiday season.'Given these trends, we are increasingly optimistic about demand for athletic footwear and apparel, and are raising our estimates for Nike for fiscal 2024 ahead of earnings,' the broker warns. title: ACCENTURE :  Wedbush Securities raises its target
full_text: Wedbush Securities announced on Thursday that it had raised its price target on Accenture from $330 to $360, while renewing its 'outperform' rating on the stock.In a research note, the intermediary says it expects a "lacklustre" release of the technology group's next quarterly results, scheduled for December 19.The analyst believes that the company will also maintain its forecast of growth at constant exchange rates between 2% and 4% for the 2023/24 financial year.This is typical of the seasonality of the months of November and December, characterized by low visibility with regard to customers' upcoming annual budgets and their investment projects", he recalls."That said, following the announcement of lower-than-expected order intake in the previous quarter, we expect the order book to recover in the first quarter of the 2023/2024 financial year", concludes Wedbush.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: ADOBE :  Jefferies raises its price target
full_text: Jefferies reaffirms its 'buy' recommendation on Adobe and raises its price target from $660 to $700, the day after a quarterly release that it believes marks 'the usual conservative start to a new financial year'.'Targets for 2024 disappointed high expectations, sending the stock down 5% after the close, but Adobe has a history of conservative ARR (annualized recurring revenue) targets', notes the broker.Pointing out that these initial targets have been consistently beaten in recent years, Jefferies believes the same should be true in 2024, pointing to a number of favorable factors linked to the adoption of Firefly generative AI.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: PFIZER :  Jefferies reduces its target on the stock
full_text: Jefferies maintains its Buy recommendation on Pfizer shares, with a price target reduced from $37 to $32.Pfizer has published its guidance for 2024 with estimated revenues of $58.5 to $61.5 billion and EPS of $2.05 to $2.25, whereas analysts were expecting $3.  The lower-than-expected EPS may be due to a lower operating margin in the core business (fixed costs related to the COVID franchise and higher new product costs), as well as higher-than-expected financing costs," the analyst points out.Jefferies believes that Pfizer's 2024 sales targets 'look very achievable', but points out that 'it will take time for Pfizer's new product cycle to take hold, and for investors to regain confidence in a management team that burned a lot of cartridges in 2023'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Novavax: green light for updated Covid vaccine in Sweden
full_text: Novavax announces that its updated protein-based mRNA-free Covid vaccine can now be ordered by healthcare professionals and used in Sweden. The Swedish Public Health Agency has recommended the vaccine for the prevention of Covid in people aged 30 and over.'We are pleased that our updated protein-based vaccine is now available so that healthcare providers can start vaccinating people before the festive season in Sweden', the laboratory reacted. The data indicate that Novavax's vaccine can induce 'a broad response against the variants currently in circulation', the laboratory reports. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: GE :  one of BofA's favorite industrial stocks
full_text: Analysts at Bank of America said Wednesday that GE shares were among their favorite industrial stocks ("top picks") in the United States for fiscal year 2024.In a sector study, BofA explains that it expects the group to benefit from the difficulties of its competitors, both in aeronautics and energy.In particular, the US broker looks favorably on the recent cancellation of an offshore wind power contract on which GE is said to have lost money, while its onshore wind power activities have only just become profitable.On the other hand, the broker doubts that the planned spin-off of Vernova, GE's energy subsidiary, next April will enable GE Aerospace to increase its stock market value.BofA, which has a Buy recommendation and a price target of $135 on the stock, specifies that its other favorite American industrial stocks are Vertiv, APi Group, Emerson ITT and Parker Hannifin.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: AIRBNB :  Barclays downgrades its recommendation
full_text: Barclays downgrades its recommendation on Airbnb from 'online weighted' to 'underweight', with a price target lowered from $135 to $100, on the occasion of a note devoted to the Internet travel retailer.The broker believes that 'online travel growth will slow from here on in, as 'pent-up' demand will eventually run out, especially as consumer wallets come under increasing pressure'. title: BEST BUY :  Jefferies raises its recommendation

title: Ericsson: share price up, broker raises recommendation
full_text: Ericsson gained just over 1% in London as Jefferies announced that it had upgraded its recommendation on the stock to buy, with a target price raised from SEK 58 to SEK 70.The research firm - which at the same time lowered its recommendation on Nokia - justifies its decision by the fact that AT&T has chosen the Swedish group for the modernization of its mobile network.In Jefferies' view, this choice could represent an "inflection point" for the equipment manufacturer, enabling it to grow both sales and profit margins from 2024 onwards.This agreement could also open the door to other contracts in 'Open RAN' technology.The analyst adds that Ericsson's increased presence in the USA should also have a positive effect on its geographical mix, which until now has made it dependent on low-margin 5G projects in India.According to the professional, the current valuation of the stock is attractive and shows real potential for revaluation.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: META PLATFORMS :  BofA reiterates buy, deems AI undervalued
full_text: Bank of America on Friday reiterated its buy recommendation on Meta Platforms, deeming the US technology group's AI projects to be 'underestimated' by the market.In a note, the US investment bank points out that Meta is currently testing some 20 AI-related functionalities in areas such as web search, chat or messaging, with the aim of improving user experience.BofA points out that most of its projects involve facilitating the integration of a chatbot and an AI image generator into its ecosystem.According to the New York firm, Meta's ability to develop new uses and recurring revenue models could, in this respect, be undervalued by investors.Its price target remains $384.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: APPLE :  Morgan Stanley raises its price target
full_text: Morgan Stanley on Friday raised its price target for Apple from 210 to 220 euros, and reiterated its 'overweight' recommendation on the stock.In a note, the broker acknowledges that the economic environment remains challenging, but is more optimistic in the face of short-term risks deemed 'more limited' or simply 'discounted'.Above all, the broker believes that the buzz around AI at the edge - which enables data to be processed from a local location rather than a remote center - could give the stock a boost.He adds that, with a PER of 26x EPS expected in 2025, Apple's current valuation is not particularly demanding, given that its three-year average is around 25x, with spreads ranging from 18x to 32x.By breaking through the $3.000 billion market capitalization yesterday, Apple came within 2% of its all-time highs, amid renewed interest in AI-related stocks.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Nike: further increase, more positive market sentiment
full_text: Nike shares continued their upward trajectory on Wall Street on Wednesday, posting a fourth session of gains (+0.3%) on the back of improving market sentiment.After losing around 27% in the first nine months of the year, mainly due to a more difficult economic context in China, the stock has rebounded by just as much since mid-September.In a note released yesterday, analysts at Wells Fargo are more positive on the stock, believing that an inflection point is materializing.The research firm explains that it expects the sports equipment maker to do better than expected when it publishes its quarterly results on December 21, leading it to raise its price target from $120 to $125.Wells Fargo, which maintains an 'overweight' recommendation on the stock, says it appreciates the American group's focus on improving profitability, a strategy which it believes should fuel the current stock market 'rally'."We believe that the turnaround underway and the improvement measures that are getting underway at Nike make it an attractive buy idea as we approach 2024", it explains.For its part, Goldman Sachs yesterday resumed coverage of the stock with a Buy recommendation and a price target of $139, representing a 21% upside potential over 12 months, anticipating a more favorable trend in costs and inventories.Despite its recent stock market rebound, the share is still down around 1% since the beginning of the year.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Remy Cointreau: share price falls, UBS no longer buy
full_text: Remy Cointreau's share price is down nearly 3% on the Paris stock exchange after UBS downgraded its rating on the stock.UBS has lowered its recommendation on the stock to Neutral (from Buy), with a revised target price of E113 (from E162). This new target represents a 5% increase on the current share price. The analysts have decided to reduce their recommendation until American cognac finds a balance.  Remy Cointreau could evolve steadily with negative organic sales until the first half of fiscal 2025. There should be a trend towards inventory rebuilding in the US from the 2nd half of 2025 and into 2026, but valuation relative to stocks in the same sector is not cheap' says UBS in its analysis of the day.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: IBM :  Bank of America raises its price target
full_text: Bank of America announced Tuesday that it has raised its price target for IBM from $155 to $170, while reiterating its Buy recommendation on the stock.In a research note, the analyst believes that the American technology group seems to be approaching fiscal 2024 in good conditions, both in terms of sales growth and profit margins.The intermediary points out that its business continues to be driven by software and consulting, with the latter sector benefiting in particular from the signing of new contracts and strong demand for hybrid cloud and AI.BofA also believes that the weakening dollar could be a positive factor for the company's business.Against this backdrop, BofA is confident that the company will continue its turnaround, praising its "defensive" portfolio, attractive dividend yield and "underestimated" offering in AI and quantum computing.While IBM's stock has rebounded by 18% since the end of October, it has significantly underperformed the S&P 500 this year, with a gain of 14% versus +20% for the benchmark index of American managers, BofA points out.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. full_text: Mizuho announced on Monday that it had upgraded its recommendation on General Motors shares from 'neutral' to 'buy', while raising its target price from €38 to €42.The analyst justifies his decision by the fact that the stock is currently trading at valuation multiples at ten-year lows due to consumer mistrust, the consequences of the UAW strike and the difficulties encountered by the American automotive group in the electric sector.Among the catalysts envisaged by the intermediary are the prospect of a savings program that should more than offset the wage increases induced by the settlement, the attention now being paid to profitability, the interruption of investment in the loss-making Cruise division and the forthcoming launch of a 10 billion euro share buyback program.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Snap: Jefferies lifts the stock to annual highs
full_text: Snap shares are up sharply on Thursday after Jefferies raised its recommendation on the stock, saying it was optimistic about catalysts on the horizon to 2024.Shortly before 11:00 am (New York time), shares in the owner of the Snapchat app jumped over 7%, returning to highs since spring 2022.Since the beginning of the year, the share price has climbed by over 45%.Analysts at Jefferies announced this morning that they had raised their recommendation to Buy, and also raised their price target on the stock from $12 to $16.In its note, the research firm says it sees the beginnings of an imminent turnaround in the Direct Response advertising offer, which generates between 70% and 75% of the Group's sales, and which it expects to accelerate next year to achieve growth of around 15%, compared with an expected decline of around 7% in 2023.At the same time, Jefferies believes that the possibility of now directly accessing Amazon's shopping cart from its platform illustrates the company's desire to strengthen its links with advertisers, a way, in its view, of intelligently increasing advertising revenues.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: GE HEALTHCARE :  Jefferies initiates 'hold' coverage
full_text: On Thursday, Jefferies initiated a "hold" recommendation on GE HealthCare shares, with a target price of $80.In a research note, the financial intermediary points out that the US group holds leading positions in well-established but growing markets such as medical imaging, ultrasound, patient monitoring and diagnostics.These businesses represent a total market potential of around $84 billion, based on annual growth of 4.5%, or the equivalent of some $100 billion by 2025, not counting adjacencies, which could generate a further $50 billion, Jefferies points out.Given that GEHC has stated that it is targeting sales growth of around 15% for an adjusted operating margin of 20%, compared with 15% in 2022, the analyst anticipates growth of 13% over the 2023/2025 period, in line with other major medtech groups.But with a PER of around 17x, Jefferies sees only limited potential for revaluation at current levels.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: CRH :  Oddo BHF confirms its recommendation on the stock
full_text: Oddo BHF maintains its 'outperform' rating on CRH shares, with an unchanged target price of €66.The analyst points out that CRH reported 9m EBITDA in line with consensus at $4.8bn, +14% and +9% L/L.Separately, CRH announced a $2.1 bn acquisition in Texas in the Cement/ RMC business, representing 12.1x EV/EBITDA 2023.Although management has not mentioned the amount of expected synergies, Oddo BHF points out that Texas is one of the most dynamic states in terms of population growth and industrial relocations.  CRH's share price has reacted rather well to this well-balanced publication and to the acquisition of Martin Marietta's Cement/Concrete assets in Texas", says the broker, adding that "the main listing in Uncle Sam's country should undeniably support the share price in the coming months, especially in view of the company's entry into the indexes in March". title: FERRARI :  UBS revises its price target upwards
full_text: UBS announced on Tuesday that it was maintaining its Buy recommendation on Ferrari, but had revised its price target upwards, from $380 to $417, which represents a potential upside of over 16%.In a wide-ranging study devoted to the luxury sector, the broker stresses that the sports car manufacturer's stock represents a key defensive choice in an uncertain economic environment and a luxury market in decline.The broker highlights the Maranello-based group's strong exposure to the ultra-rich segment and the visibility provided by its record order book, which already guarantees business for the 2025 financial year.After a historic 2023, UBS says it expects more "normalized" growth, of around 10% excluding currency effects in 2024, while highlighting its acceleration vis-à-vis the rest of the luxury sector.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Boeing leads Dow Jones, Deutsche Bank upgrades to buy
full_text: Boeing climbed on the New York Stock Exchange on Monday after Deutsche Bank upgraded its recommendation to "buy" on the US aerospace giant.An hour after the opening, Boeing shares were up almost 4%, and led the Dow Jones index, which gained 0.2% at the same time.The research firm points to an acceleration in the aircraft manufacturer's deliveries, likely to improve the group's cash flow (FCF) and boost the share price.We remind investors that the last time Boeing experienced a favorable inflection point in its FCF forecasts was in 2017, when market estimates were revised upwards by 46%, leading to an 89% rise in the share price over the year', the analyst reminds us.Against this backdrop, Deutsche has raised its recommendation from 'hold' to 'buy', with a price target raised from 204 to 270 euros, showing a potential upside of 30%.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: GAP :  Wells Fargo raises its price target
full_text: Wells Fargo announced on Friday that it had raised its price target on Gap shares from $16 to $20, the day after the publication of the ready-to-wear group's quarterly accounts.Despite high expectations, the apparel specialist delivered the most impressive performance of the entire U.S. earnings season, the California-based bank points out in a note.Although the bar was set very high due to the recent bout of optimism that has gripped the stock, Gap managed to exceed the market's highest expectations, Wells Fargo continues.While the U.S. firm is particularly impressed by the performance of the Old Navy brand, it points out that Gap's flagship store also did much better than expected, showing that the introduction of a new management team is 'already beginning to bear fruit'.With a favorable base effect, this inflection point is a key element for the stock, concludes the bank, which believes that this situation gives rise to increased visibility on the stock's upward potential.Wells Fargo - which has an 'overweight' recommendation on Gap - says it still considers the stock its 'top pick' within the sector.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: INTEL :  Mizuho upgrades to buy
full_text: Mizuho Securities announced Thursday that it has upgraded its recommendation on Intel from 'neutral' to 'buy', with a price target raised from $37 to $50.In a research note, the financial intermediary says it expects a turnaround in both the PC and data center server markets for 2024.The analyst also expects solid product launches from the chipmaker next year, with a project portfolio deemed more promising than that of its competitors.At the same time, Mizuho sees the spin-off of Altera's FPGA programmable circuits generating $17 of additional value per share, implying a total sum-of-the-parts of $84 by 2024-2025.Despite all these buoyant elements, Intel shares are currently trading at a discount of over 50% to Nvidia's 80%, he points out.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: MICROSOFT :  Wedbush again raises its price target
full_text: Wedbush Securities on Thursday raised its price target for Microsoft from $400 to $425, while renewing its 'outperform' rating on the stock.According to its contacts with the IT group's customers, the monetization of artificial intelligence has only just begun, but could well be a game-changer for the Redmond-based company.According to his calculations, AI-related functionalities could represent over 50% of the software maker's installed base within three years, generating some $20 billion in additional sales by 2025.From Wedbush's point of view, Microsoft's share price does not yet reflect the full implications of this profound underlying trend."We continue to believe that we are experiencing a 1995-like moment with AI, with a wave of technology investment unseen since the start of the Internet era at the turn of the 90s", concludes the broker.Microsoft thus remains on its 'best ideas list' as we approach 2024.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Colgate-Palmolive: up slightly, an analyst's opinion
full_text: Colgate-Palmolive gains just under 1% in New York as Jefferies today announced that it is tracking the stock with a 'buy' recommendation and a price target of $87, forecasting 16% upside potential for the stock over the next 12 months, outperforming its peers.  Colgate's geographic/category mix, margin recovery opportunities and RGM capabilities (revenue growth management) position the business to outperform", the broker believes. title: COCA-COLA :  Jefferies initiates 'hold' coverage
full_text: On Monday, Jefferies initiated coverage of Coca-Cola shares with a 'hold' recommendation and a $64 price target.In a research note, the broker believes that between its favorable business momentum and solid fundamentals, the soda maker has "a lot to offer" to investors.He points to the Atlanta-based group's flattering growth track record, which he attributes to its revenue growth management (RGM) efforts, the full potential of which could be unlocked by its strategy to become a "total beverage company".While the broker sees limited downside potential at current valuation levels, he also sees limited upside potential given the prospect of a heavy tax settlement on the horizon, which he believes could wipe out up to $24 billion in capitalization.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. title: Accor: share price downgraded by Barclays
full_text: Accor shares fell by over 3% on the Paris Bourse on Friday, penalized by a downgrade by Barclays, which is concerned about the worsening economic and geopolitical environment.In a research note, the intermediary fears that the hotel group's stock will turn into a "value trap" in the coming months, i.e., an undervalued portfolio with no real potential for recovery.While acknowledging that the stock is currently cheap, with an Enterprise Value/Ebitda ratio of 9.2x by 2024, the analyst is alarmed by the rise in geopolitical risks due to the intensification of tensions in the Middle East.The professional is also concerned about the growing terrorist threat in France and the warning issued by the United States to tourists wishing to visit France.These factors more than offset, in his view, the positive effects of the Olympic Games in Paris and the upturn in business in China.Against this backdrop, Barclays has downgraded its recommendation from 'overweight' to 'weighted in line', and says it prefers another group in the sector, the British Whitbread, on which it remains 'overweight'.Its price target has also been lowered from €39 to €33.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Rémy Cointreau: in the green with brokers' comments
full_text: Bucking the trend in Paris, Rémy Cointreau is up over 1% on the back of comments from brokers, including Stifel, which is maintaining its 'buy' recommendation despite reducing its target price from 187 to 150 euros.While acknowledging that 'cognac faces strong short-term challenges in the US', it continues to appreciate the French spirits group's strong exposure to this category, deemed 'highly profitable and oligopolistic'.Similarly, although it anticipates a drop in sales of over 35% in the US for the cognac business, UBS reiterates its 'buy' recommendation and price target of 179 euros, considering that 'long-term opportunities outweigh short-term risks'.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: SES-imagotag: buyers encouraged by an analyst
full_text: With gains of almost 7%, SES-imagotag shares were by far the biggest risers on the SBF 120 index on Tuesday morning on the Paris Bourse, following encouraging comments from Berenberg analysts.The German bank - which had briefly placed its recommendation on the stock "under review" - explained this morning that it was reiterating its "buy" recommendation, accompanied by a new price target of 215 euros, compared with 175 euros previously.In its research note, the German firm believes that investors should be prepared for a resurgence of buying interest in the stock following the recent accusations made by the US Gotham fund.In our view, the consensus does not fully reflect the margin-increasing nature of its penetration rate in a high-value-added segment, nor its growing adoption in the market, particularly in the US", explains Berenberg.Its new price target shows a potential upside of around 73% compared with Monday evening's closing price. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: BioMérieux: share price up, broker raises his recommendation
full_text: bioMérieux gained almost 2% on the Paris stock exchange after Oddo BHF raised its recommendation on the stock from 'neutral' to 'outperform', and included it in its 'European midcap list', with a price target maintained at 105 euros, in view of the recent downturn in the share price, although visibility seems good.bioMérieux should benefit from several growth opportunities in the short and medium term", believes the analyst, who cites in particular its new lowplex diagnostic systems, SpotFire, launched last March in the United States.Assuming a slowdown in sales of respiratory panels, Oddo BHF expects consolidated sales to grow by +4% to +6% at constant exchange rates and scope of consolidation (or 8-10% excluding respiratory panels linked to Covid) in 2023.The stock is trading at 16 times 12-month EBIT, below its 10-year average of 19 times, despite an industry position that has never looked so favorable", he judges, pointing out, among other things, higher margins than before Covid. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Nexans: up sharply, broker in support
full_text: Nexans is up more than 8% in Paris after Bank of America announced it was raising its recommendation on the stock from 'underperform' to 'buy', with a price target raised from 65 to 100 euros.In a research note, the analyst justifies his decision by the cable manufacturer's strong exposure to the fast-growing power grid infrastructure and offshore wind energy markets, which together generate almost 50% of its current operating income (Ebitda).It also points to Nexans' excellent positioning in high-voltage cables, which it attributes to the Group's footprint in the USA and the highly profitable projects in its order book.Finally, BofA points out that the stock has underperformed its benchmark European index, the STOXX Europe 600 Industrial Goods & Services, by 28% since the start of the year.At current levels, the stock's devaluation relative to the rest of the sector has now reached 40%, compared with 10% last October, he points out, a level which he believes more than reflects the risks associated with the construction and high-voltage networks sectors.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: S&P Global Ratings Downgrades Nasdaq Following Adenza Acquisition
full_text:
By Denny Jacob 
  S&P Global Ratings on Monday said it downgraded Nasdaq's long-term issuer credit ratings and senior unsecured notes to BBB from BBB+. 

  The ratings agency said the downgrade is a result of Nasdaq's planned acquisition of Adenza, which provides capital markets and regulatory solutions to financial institutions, for $10.5 billion and transaction costs, including $5.75 billion in cash and the remainder in common equity. 

  S&P said it expects the Adenza transaction to close within six to nine months and for Nasdaq to raise about $5.9 billion of new debt to fund the acquisition. The financing for the acquisition would weaken Nasdaq's financial risk profile, S&P said. 

  "Nasdaq's funds from operations to debt will drop well below 23% in the next two years, materially weaker than our previous base case, which did not consider the Adenza acquisition," S&P said. 
  Write to Denny Jacob at denny.jacob@wsj.com 
  (END) Dow Jones Newswires

  06-12-23 1045ET

title: Nexans soars, boosted by BofA recommendation upgrade
full_text: The share price of Nexans, the producer of fiber optic and copper cables, jumped on the stock market Monday morning, supported by a recommendation upgrade from Bank of America (BofA).               The share price was up 8.44% at 09:01 GMT to 79.05 euros on the Paris Bourse, the best performance of the CAC40, which was up 0.83% at the same time.               The stock was supported by Bank of America's change of recommendation to "buy" from "underperform", with a target price of 100 euros.               The company's exposure to renewable energies, its presence in the United States and its discount to the sector, which has reached 40% since the beginning of the year, justify the change of recommendation, explains BofA in a note. (Reported by Corentin Chappron, edited by Kate Entringer)

title: Sanofi: share price ends the day higher, brokers' opinions
full_text: Sanofi shares ended the day up nearly 1%. Several analysts have commented on the stock following the positive data on Dupixent.Barclays today upgraded its advice on Sanofi from 'in-line weighted' to 'overweight' following the 'impressive' clinical results unveiled last week for Dupixent in the treatment of COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease).In a study of the European pharmaceutical sector, the analyst explains that he now expects annual sales of 22 billion euros for Dupixent by 2030, compared with a forecast of 16.5 billion euros to date.In his opinion, this development highlights the value side of Sanofi shares, i.e. their low valuation compared with other stocks such as GSK or Novartis.With investors increasingly concerned about the impact of the Inflation Reduction Act (IRA) on the sector, we consider Sanofi to be protected in the short term", adds the intermediary.The legislation introduced in the USA under the IRA provides for a cap on drug prices.Morgan Stanley says it has also raised its target price for the stock from €90 to €115.Jefferies also reaffirms its 'buy' recommendation and 120 euro price target on Sanofi, welcoming the release of positive Phase III data for its flagship drug Dupixent in COPD (chronic obstructive pulmonary disease)."Dupixent significantly reduced exacerbations and improved lung function, and could thus be the first biologic drug approved for this important market opportunity if the second trial succeeds in the first half of 2024", it points out. The broker points out that its sales estimate for Dupixent of €20 billion by 2031 includes only €0.7 billion for COPD, implying upside potential for the healthcare group's long-term EPS in the event of success.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Pernod Ricard: share price downgraded by broker
full_text: Pernod Ricard is down just over 1% in Paris after JPMorgan on Monday downgraded its recommendation on the stock from 'overweight' to 'neutral' due to fears of a slowdown in the US spirits market.The research firm points out that the French group's stock has performed well recently - thanks to its solid pricing - but believes that this good performance may not withstand any disappointments in the US.JPMorgan points out that Pernod Ricard has underperformed the US market since 2020, a phenomenon which does not seem to have improved in recent months, in its opinion.However, its share price has risen by 13% since the start of the year, doing much better than the sector in Europe (+4%), but also than Diageo (-1%), points out the analyst, who has therefore decided to place the stock on negative watch ahead of the publication of third-quarter sales, scheduled for the end of April. Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: L'Oréal: its defensive and cyclical profile helps the share price.
full_text: On Tuesday, L'Oréal shares continued to benefit from their status as a defensive stock in a market still held back by fears about the health of the US banking sector following the SVB bankruptcy.At around 11:45 a.m., the share price was up 0.2%, while at the same time, the CAC 40 was down 0.1% and the STOXX index for the European non-essential consumption sector was down around 1%.The share price has only fallen by around 0.7% over the last five sessions, while the CAC has lost more than 4%.In a research note published yesterday, Deutsche Bank analysts indicated that they had made the French cosmetics giant's stock a buy investment idea in the short term.The research firm explains that the data testifies to an acceleration in the group's activity within distribution networks, an indicator that usually precedes a good performance in the share price over a four-month horizon, in its view.While it acknowledges that the current valuation of the stock is high compared with its historical average, Deutsche Bank expects the quality of its results to limit any potential devaluation in the short term.Historically, the stock has outperformed the market during previous US recessions, and has an option to accelerate growth due to its exposure to China and the structural growth associated with its business model, should the macroeconomic environment continue to prove more resilient than expected", he concludes.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Rémy Cointreau : continues to grow, brokers' opinions
full_text: At the end of the day, Rémy Cointreau's share price was up by more than 3%, representing a gain of almost 11% in one month. UBS has reaffirmed its 'buy' recommendation on Rémy Cointreau, with its price target maintained at 195 euros, a target that implies a 13% upside potential for the wine and spirits house's stock.'Strong brand equity and consumption oriented towards high-income drinkers should make Remy Martin more resilient as we enter a recessionary environment', the broker judges in the summary of its note.For its part, Stifel anticipates the announcement, on January 27, of a decline of around 6% in organic sales in the third accounting quarter, dragged down by cognac in the United States due to the ongoing realignment of sales and a strong basis for comparison.The company has the highest exposure to China among our main European peers, which should finally pay off despite the disruption resulting from the policy reversal on the Covid zero," he notes.While reiterating its 'buy' recommendation on Rémy Cointreau, considering that an 'attractive entry point allows for patience', Stifel adjusts its price target from 200 to 197 euros to take into account a weaker dollar.Copyright (c) 2023 CercleFinance.com. All rights reserved.

title: Banks Releasing Loan Reserves Face Tricky Accounting Estimates as Economy Improves
full_text:
By Mark Maurer 

     Banks and other financial institutions are devising how to release large loan reserves under an accounting rule that complicates the task of calculating them. 

     To do so, executives at companies including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Citizens Financial Group Inc. are scrutinizing metrics such as credit quality and loan growth to help estimate the level of future reserves amid the continuing economic uncertainty. 

     Many lenders bulked up their loan reserves this time last year to prepare for potential defaults during the onset of the pandemic, cutting into profits. Banks' provisions for credit losses totaled $61.91 billion in the second quarter of 2020, compared with $12.84 billion during the prior-year period, according to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp., a federal banking regulator. 

     Now, investors and analysts are increasingly questioning the banks on when their reserves will go back to pre-pandemic levels. But jumping the gun could be dangerous: Lowering reserves too quickly and then needing to rebuild them could hurt companies' credibility and reduce income, accountants and advisers say. 

     Under U.S. accounting standards, companies are required to forecast expected losses as soon as a loan is issued. The rule, known as Current Expected Credit Losses, or CECL, went into effect for large public firms in January 2020, with some of them choosing to delay implementing it for a year because of the pandemic. Private and smaller public companies have until 2023 to adopt CECL. 

     Companies previously didn't have to book losses until they had evidence -- such as the default of a borrower -- that the losses had actually occurred. 

     CECL particularly impacts financial institutions because loans comprise a large portion of their assets. The standard also affects nonfinancial companies with financial assets ranging from loans to debt securities. Bankers say the rule makes company earnings more unpredictable. The Financial Accounting Standards Board, which sets U.S. accounting standards, however, has said the rule more closely aligns companies' accounting with actual credit risks and provides investors with more transparency. 

     The improved economic outlook and soaring markets are leading banks to slash the funds they held for loan losses, thus boosting profits. JPMorgan on April 14 said it freed up $5.2 billion in funds it had allocated to cover soured loans, bringing its reserves to $25.6 billion. The bank's loan assets totaled $1.01 trillion as of March 31. 

     The bank released most of the $5.2 billion in its consumer credit-card division because certain mortgage delinquencies remain low and U.S. employment levels have improved, Chief Financial Officer Jennifer Piepszak said on an earnings call. JPMorgan declined to comment beyond its filing and the earnings call. 

     Executives are careful about the amount of reserves they hold because they are unsure about where the economy is headed, said Donald Fandetti, a managing director of equity research at Wells Fargo & Co.'s securities division. The bank on April 14 said it released about $1.7 billion, bringing its reserves to $18 billion in the first quarter. "Everybody is leaving a bit of cushion," Mr. Fandetti said. 

     Citizens Financial Group also lowered its reserves. The bank on April 16 said it let out $298 million in the quarter ended March 31, compared with the $463 million it built up during the prior-year period. Citizens said it made the move because of the improved economic outlook. The bank's credit-loss provision was $1.62 billion in 2020, up from an average of $352.3 million during the previous four years. 

     The Providence, R.I.-based bank overrode the economic forecasts it usually relies on from ratings firms and other external providers to better incorporate economic uncertainty into its reserve levels, CFO John Woods said. Those forecasts are highly dependent on factors such as the efficacy of Covid-19 vaccines, Mr. Woods said. 

     Citizens is weighing other scenarios to project credit losses, such as slower vaccination rates and consumer spending, he said. "That's where the judgment comes in to layer in additional reserve requirements to deal with some of those contingencies," he said. 

     Investors generally like it when banks bring down their reserves because it frees up capital for lending and investments, said Janet Pegg, an analyst at research firm Zion Research Group. Continuing to hold high reserves could signal to the market that a company is overly pessimistic about its loan book. 

     The FASB is considering whether to make changes to the standard. For that, it is consulting companies, investors and other stakeholders, and plans to host a roundtable discussion on May 20. 

     Firms that haven't had to implement the rule yet are also watching closely. Texas Security Bank, a privately held Dallas-based lender, is studying the techniques that big banks use to determine their provision for credit losses, CFO Drew Keith said. 

     "The big takeaway we have is that you do have to be careful with the subjective part of it," he said, referring to forecasting losses under the standard. Mr. Keith said he plans to consider a mix of different economic forecasts, including those from research firms Moody's Analytics, a subsidiary of Moody's Corp., and ITR Economics. 

     Write to Mark Maurer at mark.maurer@wsj.com 


  (END) Dow Jones Newswires

  05-10-21 0814ET
